roles.title: medic and support provider

roles.title: representing herself in military trials
quotes: Representing herself, Michel admitted to the accusations of having instigated lower-class, uneducated women to take up arms against the government and having been complicit in the Commune’s power structure.

roles.title: advocate for marginalized groups
quotes: Even in exile in New Caledonia, where she lived for eight years, Michel found ways to advocate for marginalized groups.

roles.title: contributor to the first French-Kanak dictionary
quotes: she encouraged them to revolt against the French colonial power and contributed to the first French-Kanak dictionary.
which developed in the tumultuous 1860s in Paris.
She requested the death penalty for these actions but was instead sent to exile in New Caledonia in 1872.
During the 1880s and 1890s she continued to write and lecture on revolutionary themes, women’s rights and anarchist social thought from London and Paris until her death in 1905.
On her return to France Michel was again imprisoned for three years due to her participation in a bread riot.
